node.title: As Flight Centre threatens a fresh hard border challenge, the WA government says it's 'up for the fight'
node.alt: A tight head and shoulders shot of a frowning WA Health Minister Roger Cook.
node.description: Western Australia's Health Minister Roger Cook says he is confident the state can fight another legal challenge against its hard border, asÂ Flight Centre threatens a fresh court dispute.
node.content:
["Western Australia's Health Minister Roger Cook says he is confident the state can fight another legal challenge against its hard border, as\u00a0Flight Centre threatens a fresh court dispute.", "Flight Centre CEO Graham Turner said the business was looking to mount a legal challenge following the release of WA's transition plan\u00a0on Friday.", "The plan will see WA's border stay closed until 90 per cent of the state's population aged 12 and over is fully vaccinated.", "Mr Turner told the ABC the company was yet to make a final decision.", "\"We had a conference on Friday morning with our legal team and a QC,\" he said.", "\"But we have been working on this for some time. We are looking at going to the Federal Court for a judicial review.", "\"Basically, looking at the border directions and the reasonableness of those, taking into account section 92 of the constitution which allows for freedom of movement between states and freedom of trade between states.", "\"We have not made a final decision yet. We will be consulting with our legal team this week, and also the other businesses in travel, tourism, and WA businesses we are working with.\"", "
Different to Clive Palmer\u00a0case: Turner
", "Billionaire miner Clive Palmer lost his High Court challenge against WA's coronavirus border closure in November last year.", "Mr Turner said Flight Centre's case, if it went ahead, would be different.", "", "
Flight Centre CEO Graham Turner says a final decision about a legal challenge is yet to be made.(Thomas Pawson)
", "\"We will be looking at a judicial review in the Federal Court, rather than a constitutional challenge in the High Court,\" he said.", "\"The other big difference is that there are widespread vaccinations now.", "Mr Turner said he would not proceed unless he was confident of success.", "He said WA was the focus, despite Tasmania also having a 90 per cent vaccination threshold for its border.", "", "
WA's vaccination rate is continuing to lag behind the rest of the country.(ABC News: Eliza Laschon)
", "\"We are focused on WA because they seem most unreasonable,\" he said.", "
Cook vows WA ready for challenge
", "WA Health Minister Roger Cook the state government was \"up for the fight\".", "\"We've had legal challenges in the past and we've faced them all. Our objective is to keep Western Australians safe in the context of a public health emergency,\" he said.", "\"I think people appreciate the objectives of the government and the goals that we are trying to achieve on behalf of the people of Western Australia.", "\"People can have their legal challenges, but we are up for that fight.", "\"If people want to challenge these decisions, they are at liberty to do so, but we are confident of all the measures that we have put in place.\""]
